text: Tomorrow belongs to those who can hear it coming.
author: David Bowie

text: Sometimes it's not enough to know what things mean, sometimes you have to know what things don't mean.
author: Bob Dylan

text: Really good music isn't just to be heard, you know? It's almost like a hallucination.
author: Iggy Pop

text: I like the idea of being alone. I like the idea of often being alone in all aspects of my life. I like to feel lonely. I like to need things.
author: Robert Plant

text: Music can always serve a role in people's lives when it's emotional and warm and inviting and beautiful.
author: Moby

text: I don't make changes to confuse anyone. I'm just searching. That's what causes me to change. I'm just searching for myself.
author: David Bowie

text: It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.
author: John Lennon

text: The future is uncertain but the end is always near.
author: Jim Morrison

text: People are so brainwashed by the rules that they don't know what really matters.
author: Mick Jagger

text: You've got to believe in yourself, or no one will believe in you. Imagination is like a bird on the wing, flying free for you to use.
author: Ozzy Osbourne

text: Those that have lived longer than us always have something to teach us, that we can take with us for the rest of our lives.
author: Johnny Cash

text: All art is unstable. Its meaning is not necessarily that implied by the author. There is no authoritative voice. There are only multiple readings.
author: David Bowie

text: We age not by holding on to youth, but by letting ourselves grow and embracing whatever youthful parts remain.
author: Keith Richards

text: Live music is the most primal form of energy release you can share with other people besides having sex or taking drugs.
author: Kurt Cobain

text: Excess is part of my nature. Dullness is a disease. I really need danger and excitement. I'm never scared of putting myself out on a limb.
author: Freddie Mercury

text: Life is an adventure of our own design intersected by fate and a series of lucky and unlucky accidents.
author: Patti Smith

text: Just another lonely broken hero picking up the pieces of my mind. Running out of faith and hope and reason, I'm running out of time.
author: Ozzy Osbourne
